quiz.text: The Company makes a toy in which a cone is mounted on the base of a hemisphere If the total surface area of the toy is 1782 cm2 then find the approximate volume of one toy?
options: 12554.5 cm3
13223.23 cm3
14000 cm3
12190.33 cm3
12730.67cm3

quiz.text: The company makes a unique toy in which a cube is mounted on the cylinder such that cylinder top is exactly in middle of the face of cube. Find the total surface area of the toy formed, if the height of formed toy is  times the height of cylinder and curved surface area of cylinder in  is 33 times the height of cylinder in cm?
options: 425. 526cm2
446.625 cm2
440.552 cm2
421.522cm2
466.625cm2

quiz.text: If the manufacturing unit makes a toy in which a given sphere is cut into two hemispheres and these hemispheres are mounted on both ends of the cylinder, then find the ratio between the volume of the toy so formed to the volume of the sphere.
options: 10:7
7:10
1:4
4:1
None of the above

quiz.text: Volume of the cuboid is approximately what per cent less or more than the volume of the cylinder if the Radius of the cylinder is 140% more than the length of the Cuboid and the Breadth of the Cuboid is 150% more than the height of the cylinder.
options: 49.65
63.47
52.36
63.36
36.36

quiz.text: Establish the relationship between the two quantities: Quantity 1: What is the difference between the Volume of the cone and the volume of the cube if side of cube is 1/3 of the height of cuboid and height of Cone is 1/3 of the height of cuboid. Quantity 2: What is the difference between Volume of the cuboid and the volume of cylinder if Radius of cylinder is 140% more than the length of Cuboid and Breadth of Cuboid is 150% more than the height of cylinder?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II

quiz.text: If the height of a cone increases by 2 times and its radius decreases by 33.33%, Then the ratio of the volume of the new cone to the volume of the previous cone is ______.
options: 8: 9
3: 1
4: 3
8: 3
None of the above

quiz.text: If the curved surface area of a cylinder is 528 cm²and its base area is 154 cm², then the volume (in cm³) of the cylinder will be _____.
options: 1848
1564
2240
2084
1460

quiz.text: A toy has a cylindrical wooden base of 14 cm radius with a conical top of 7 cm radius. If the total height of the toy is 19 cm and the height of the cone is 9 cm, then the volume (in cm³) of the toy is ______.
options: 6622
4682
7254
6872
7842

quiz.text: In A cylindrical wooden block has radius 7 cm and height 20 cm. A hemispherical portion of radius 7 cm is carved out from each of the circular ends of the block. then the volume (in cm³) of the remaining block is ______ cm3. (approx..)
options: 1662.33
1484.33
1845.67
1642.67
1582.65

quiz.text: The radius of a right circular cone is equal to 75% of its height and area of its base is 1386 cm². The total surface area of the given cone will be _____.
options: 3045 cm³
3696 cm³
4096 cm³
3244 cm³
3155 cm³

quiz.text: Directions: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantity I, II and Quantity III on its basis. (only quantity is to be considered) Quantity I: From a circular paper sheet of radius 17.5 cm, a sector of 144° is cut out and from the remaining sector a cone is made. What is the volume (in cm³) of the cone? Quantity II: A rectangular sheet of paper, with length and breadth equal to 44 cm and 10 cm respectively, is folded in such a way that its breadth becomes height of cylinder and then closed from both ends. What is the volume (in cm³) of the cylinder? Quantity III: A frustum has radius of its two faces equal to 4 cm and 5 cm and a height of 21 cm. What is the volume (in cm³) of the frustum?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II = Quantity III

quiz.text: The sum of the surface area of a cube and area of a rectangle is 3240 m². The length and breadth of the rectangle is 50% more and 40% more than the side of the cube. Quantity-I: Find the volume of the sphere that can be fitted inside the given cube such that it touches all the six faces of the cube. (Use: π = 3)Quantity-II: Find the volume of cuboidal hole of dimension equal to the rectangle and depth 4.5 m.
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

quiz.text: In the question, two quantities I and II are given. You have to solve both quantities to establish the correct relation between Quantity-I and Quantity-II and choose the correct option.Quantity-I: The height of a cylindrical tank is the same as the height of the cuboidal tank. Radius of the cylinder is 1.5 m more than the breadth of the cuboid, and 1.5 m less than the length of the cuboid. Total time taken to fill water in cylindrical tank and cuboidal tank at 4 m³per second are 77 seconds and 20 seconds, respectively. Find the curved surface area of cylindrical tank.Quantity-II: Find the surface area of the sphere having radius 3.5 m.
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

quiz.text: Quantity-I:  The ratio of volume of sphere and cone of same radius is 9:4. If the height of cone is 32 cm, then find the cost of water used to fill the cylinder having height and radius of base equal to that of cone given that the cost of water is Rs. 0.5 per cm³. (Take π = 3)Quantity-II: A toy is made by placing hemispherical structure on each of the base of a cylindrical structure. Base of each hemisphere coincides completely with the base of the cylinder with radius of the base equal to 6 cm. The height of the toy is 36 cm. Find the cost of colouring the toy if the cost is Rs.15/cm². (Take π = 3)
options: Quantity-I > Quantity-II
Quantity-I < Quantity-II
Quantity-I ≤ Quantity-II
Quantity-I = Quantity-II or No relation
Quantity-I ≥ Quantity-II

quiz.text: Directions: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantity I, II and Quantity III on its basis. (only quantity is to be considered)A cone of radius 12 cm with a slant height of 15 cm was sliced horizontally, resulting into a smaller cone (upper portion) and a frustum (lower portion). Quantity I: If the ratio of the curved surface area of the upper smaller cone and the lower frustum is 1: 2, what is the height (in cm) of the frustum?Quantity II: If the height of the frustum is 19 – 8√3 cm, what is the height (in cm) of the smaller cone?Quantity III: If the volume of the frustum is 304π cm³, what is the slant height (in cm) of the frustum?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II = Quantity III

quiz.text: The cost of painting a cubical box from both sides which is open from top and bottom is Rs. 9900. The rate of painting is Rs. 5.5/m². If each edge of the box is of ‘x’ metres, then find the total surface area of another cubical box of edge ‘x’ metres. I. (120x – 450) m²II. (4x²+ 650) m²III. (96x – 70) m²
options: All I, II and III
Only I and III
Only I
Only II
Only I and II

quiz.text: The question consists of two statements numbered “I and II” given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question.A solid wooden cone of radius 7 cm is cut vertically from the middle to form two halves. Find the volume of the wooden cone. [Use π = 3] Statement-I: If the curved surface area of one half of the cone is 82% of the curved surface area of the whole wooden cone.Statement-II: If the total surface area of the one half of the cone is 504 cm²
options: The data in statement I alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
Either statement I or statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II together is necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: The question consists of four statements: I, II, III and IV given below it. You have to decide whether the data given in which of the following statements alone is sufficient to answer the question.A cylindrical vessel contains 80% of water in it which is filled by a pipe. Find the total capacity of the cylindrical vessel. [Use π = 3]I. The difference between the curved surface area and the total surface area of the cylindrical vessel is 384 m²II. The pipe took 72 minutes to fill the given quantity of water at the rate of 32 m³ per minute.III. The curved surface area and total surface area of the vessel is 720 m²and 1104 m², respectively.IV. The cost of painting the curved surface area of the vessel at the rate of Rs. 5 per m²is Rs. 3600.
options: The data either in statement I alone or in statement IV alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement I alone or in statement III alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement III alone or in statement IV alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement II alone or in statement III alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data in any of the four statements I, II, III or IV alone are sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: The question consists of two statements numbered “I and II” given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question.Find the radius of the cylinder having capacity 9450 cm³. [Use π = 3]Statement I: Curved surface area of the cylinder is 1260 cm²Statement II: Total surface area of the cylinder is 2610 cm²
options: The data in statement I alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: The question consists of two statements numbered “I and II” given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question.A cylinder is cut vertically from the middle. Find the volume of the cylinder.Statement I: The curved surface area of the half part of the cylinder after cutting is 220 cm².Statement II: The product of the radius and height of the cylinder is 70 cm².
options: The data in statement I alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: The sides of a right triangle are 7 cm, 24 cm and 25 cm and it is the base of a right pyramid. If the volume of the pyramid is 448 cm³, then find the height of the pyramid.

15 cm

quiz.text: The length of each side of a square is 12 cm and it is the base of a pyramid. If the height of the pyramid is 8 cm, then find the lateral surface area of the pyramid.
options: 210 cm²

quiz.text: The ratio of the circumference of the base of a right circular cone and its height is 11:6, respectively. If the curved surface area of the cone is 550 cm², then find the volume of the cone.
options: 1364 cm³

quiz.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are 25 cm × 60 cm × 18 cm. The given cuboid is melted and recast into 8 identical cubes. What is the edge length of body diagonal of each of the cube thus formed?
options: 12√3 cm
15√3 cm

quiz.text: The sum of the height of a right circular cylinder and its radius is 52 cm. Total surface area of the cylinder is 13728 cm². What is the area of the base of a right circular cone if the radius of base of the cone is half the radius of that of the given cylinder?
options: 1244 cm²
